msContents.summary: Account of rations for workers on an unspecified project. The papyrus lists in spreadsheet format the new enlistees and keeps an account of clothing and grain rations.

The Frame P.Hearst04 38.2120-1 was lost by one of Reisner's misadventures, presumably at the Boston Museum of Fine Arts.

layout.ab: text begins on recto and continues on the verso

handDesc.p: Red and Black Ink. Some Fragments have traces of earlier texts which were erased. Reisner dates this earlier hand to a Dynasty 11/12 hand. Ledger lines are drawn on the papyrus in black ink.

origin.origDate: Middle Kingdom, Dynasty 11/12 between 2040 and 1640 B.C.
